data.text: Agriculture is the major occupation of the people of Pakistan.
Punjab is the most fertile and agriculturally developed region of Pakistan.
Almost 70% of the cultivated land in Pakistan is used to grow food crops.
Crops that we grow for food are called food crops.
Wheat is a major food crop and a staple food in Pakistan.
Rice is the second most cultivated crop in Pakistan. It grows well in warm and very moist places.
Millet is a hardy crop that can grow in poor soil with very little water.
Pulses and oilseeds are some other food crops grown in Pakistan.
Crops that we grow for commercial purposes are called cash crops.
Cotton is one of the major cash crops of Pakistan and its leading export.
Sugar cane is the second most important cash crop of Pakistan after cotton.
Tobacco is another important cash crop. It is also exported to other countries.
Livestock is an important sector of agriculture. Although tractors have become common, some farmers still use bullocks to plough their fields.
Pakistan is one of the world's largest producers of milk.
Most of the meat we eat comes from buffaloes, cows, and goats.
Sheep and goats are reared in hilly regions, plains, plateaus, and deserts for meat, wool, and skins.
